intro: Craterispermum brieyi, commonly known as the Bolivian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of Bolivia. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange petals and a tall, slender stem. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments. Its botanical features include alternate, lance-shaped leaves and a composite flower head. Craterispermum brieyi is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
